Summary: Orange rotating rectangle stopped, changed course
trends: There have been no other sightings in Guthriesville
This sighting has been favorited 1 time.
divs: Sighting DetailsSighted an orange rectangle (beam? bow-tie) shaped object. Rotating clockwise at 40-50 RPM or about 1 time per second. Traveling west to east. In 5 seconds it traveled about the same distance a commercial airliner would travel in 10-15 seconds. Not as fast as a fly-over of the ISS but somewhere in between. Orange beam had no additional lights and I could not ascertain structure (whether disk shaped or just an actual rectangle). After 5-seconds of straight line flight (while rotating) - it stopped for under one second and then proceeded to "dodge" or reverse direction nearly 180* while changing from a rectangle to more of a single point of orange light. It moved "upward" and to the west for under 1 second then back to the east again for under 1 second and again one or two more times. At this point, I was thinking "I believe this is out of the orindary". I then saw an approaching commercial airliner traveling west-bound from the east, presumably from PHL. It still had its take-off light on (bright light you see upon takeoff and landing). I would say that the best way to describe the object's actions was that it was nearly on a direct course toward that airliner and then proceeded to stop and get out of the way and disappear upwards and away.
